intro: Tetragonanthus perrottetii, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 centimeters and prefers warm, humid environments. Its flowers, which come in a variety of colors, bloom in spring and summer, making it a popular ornamental plant.
